clinical_study.brief_title: Oral Health and Psychosocial Factors During the Covid-19 Pandemic
clinical_study.official_title: Oral Health and Psychosocial Factors During the Covid-19 Pandemic

brief_summary.textblock: This prospective observational study examines the effects of the Covid-19 pandemic on oral health, taking psychosocial factors into account, and the possible impact of a high periodontitis risk on the severity of the need for treatment in Covid-19 patients.

primary_outcome.measure: How do people assess their oral health-related quality of life in times of the Covid-19 pandemic?
primary_outcome.description: The survey consists of validated and unvalidated items giving the opportunity to assess periodontitis risk, psychosocial stress, anxiety, depression and oral health related quality of life as well as questions focusing on experiences of the covid-19 pandemic.

primary_outcome.measure: Does the periodontitis risk have an influence on the severety of the Covid-19 disease and its' treatment?

secondary_outcome.measure: Do psychosocial stress factors in times of the Covid-19 pandemic have an impact on their oral health related quality of life?

study_pop.textblock: The largest possible number of people should be given the opportunity to participate in this questionnaire considered the eligibility criteria.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- ≥18 years old
- Residence in Germany
- Understanding of study participation and consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- <18 years old
- Residence outside of Germany
